text: A subdomain is the portion shown before a domain name, separated by a dot (.) For example, a domain might look like this :example.com Whereas the subdomain of this domain might look like this, shown here in bold :subdomain.example.com'' == Examples == Many sites use sub domains for applications such as email, calendars or different languages, including these examples. Subdomains again shown in bold * mail.yahoo.com * calendar.google.com * en.wikipedia.org Category:Domain Name System
title: Subdomain
